choices.A: Use a DoS attack on external hosts.

discussion.content:

Based on the provided log entries, the user is attempting to relay email. This can be inferred from the log entries that show attempts to establish connections to external IP addresses on port 25, which is the default port for SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) used for email transmission.

I'm going more with B, someone is trying to exfiltrate data using email, error 403 is an HTTP status code meaning access to the requested resource is forbidden. The server understood the request, but will not fulfill it. (blocked)

the port for ip addreses is 25 , for SMTP. it means the host is trying to relay email .

Selected Answer: B
The get command transfers the files from a remote server to the local system, while the put command does the opposite. The get command uses the following basic syntax: get [path to file] Using the get command transfers a file from the remote server to the local system's Home directory. For instance: get example01.txt

choices.A: Filter all inputs, applying the allow list concept for each parameter from XML content.
choices.B: Enable an XML external entity and escape each parameter that is received through the XML file.
choices.C: Implement parameterized queries for each XML parser.
choices.D: Disable document type definitions completely using the proper method for each parser.

questions.question_text: During an investigation, an analyst discovers a server is vulnerable to an attack against an application that processes XML input. Which of the following controls must be in place to prevent such an attack?

discussion.content:
The safest way to prevent XXE is always to disable DTDs (External Entities) completely. Depending on the parser.
If it is not possible to disable DTDs completely, then external entities and external document type declarations must be disabled in a way that's specific to each parser.

So I think its D

helper source: https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html

comments.content: I concur its D, Virtually all XXE vulnerabilities arise because the application's XML parsing library supports potentially dangerous XML features that the application does not need or intend to use. The easiest and most effective way to prevent XXE attacks is to disable those features.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A is the legal department/maybe PR's job. B and D are not the business of a Security Analyst. C is makes the most sense.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.A: To determine when information can be released
choices.B: To provide rules and regulations on reporting requirements
choices.C: To prevent an inadvertent release of information

questions.question_text: During an incident, an analyst works closely with specific team members. Which of the following best explains why communication is limited to specific team members?

choices.A: Configure DLP to reject all changes to the files without pre-authorization. Monitor the files for unauthorized changes.
choices.B: Regularly use SHA-256 to hash the directory containing the sensitive information. Monitor the files for unauthorized changes.
choices.D: Use Wireshark to scan all traffic to and from the directory. Monitor the files for unauthorized changes.
choices.C: Place a legal hold on the files. Require authorized users to abide by a strict time context access policy. Monitor the files for unauthorized changes.

questions.question_text: A company's Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is concerned about the integrity of some highly confidential files. Any changes to these files must be tied back to a specific authorized user's activity session. Which of the following is the best technique to address the CISO's concerns?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
if you want to pass go for A this straight from official PDF

Remediation is the action the DLP software takes when it detects a policy violation. The
following remediation mechanisms are typical:
• Alert only—The copying is allowed, but the management system records an incident
and may alert an administrator.
• Block—The user is prevented from copying the original file but retains access to it.
The user may or may not be alerted to the policy violation, but it will be logged as an
incident by the management engine.
• Quarantine—Access to the original file is denied to the user (or possibly any user).
This might be accomplished by encrypting the file in place or by moving it to a
quarantine area in the file system.
• Tombstone—The original file is quarantined and replaced with one describing the
policy violation and how the user can release it again.
Lesson

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A. CISO is concerned about files being changed without authorization. B sounds good, but it would still allow users to change the data, could this be tracked, yes but potentially not fast enough in a certain situation. A will restrict users from changing the files without prior authorization.
A company's Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is concerned about the integrity of some highly confidential files. Any changes to these files must be tied back to a specific authorized user's activity session. Which of the following is the best technique to address the CISO's concerns?

Selected Answer: B
Only B includes hashing which verifies the integrity, and it also includes monitoring files for unauthorized changes. DLP is incapable of doing this.

A is the answer. Implementing DLP provides access control and then just says "monitor" which could mean anything from someone staring at directory or using something like MS FIM, all of which provide file integrity.
The changes have to tied to a specific user session. DLP will do the job. correct answer is A

comments.content:
Data loss prevention (DLP) is a set of tools and processes used to ensure that sensitive data is not lost, misused, or accessed by unauthorized users

So I think A would work well
You're right. The people saying DLP must not have worked with DLP or file hashing before.

"Any changes to these files must be tied back to a specific authorized user's activity session" Hashing would tell you the file was changed, how would you know if it was with or without authorization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
if integrity of files is an issue, then implementing SHA-256 to hash files should be the solution. I don't think DLP would be the best option here, thoughts?

AV = $1000
EF = 20%

SLE is AV X EF 
SLE = 1000 X 0.20 = $200

The Additional information is for the ALE, but that's not needed.

ALE = SLE * ARO
1000 = SLE * 5 
SLE = 200

Am I Right ?

comments.content: The formula is correct, I'll go for A too.

I think, we don't know the ALE here, so i would calculate
SLE=Asset Value * Exposure Factor=1000$ * 0.20=200$

questions.question_text: During a risk assessment, a senior manager inquires about what the cost would be if a unique occurrence would impact the availability of a critical service. The service generates $1,000 in revenue for the organization. The impact of the attack would affect 20% of the server's capacity to perform jobs. The organization expects that five out of twenty attacks would succeed during the year. Which of the following is the calculated single loss expectancy?
